case_title: Abdul Asif vs Commissioner Inland Revenue Zone (WHT), RTO-III, Karachi
respondent: Commissioner Inland Revenue Zone (WHT), RTO-III, Karachi

grounds_of_appeal: Order passed by Commissioner Inland Revenue (Appeals) is illegal and bad in law.
Notice issued under section 122(5A) and proceedings initiated are without jurisdiction and violate specific conditions.
Notice for compliance on 22-03-2017 was neither issued nor served on the appellant.
Order passed on 23-07-2017 without issuing a fresh notice is illegal.
Exemption claimed under Clause (39) of Part I of Second Schedule of Income Tax Ordinance, 2001 was not considered.
Commissioner Inland Revenue (Appeals) wrongly relied on Clause 39 of Part VI instead of Part I of Second Schedule.
Judgment of Peshawar High Court regarding exemption of Special Judicial Allowance was ignored.
Employees of High Courts are similarly situated and entitled to exemption under Article 208 of the Constitution of Pakistan.

facts_of_case.appellant_position: Private Secretary at Sindh High Court

legal_findings.special_judicial_allowance: Not chargeable to income tax as per Section 12(2)(c) and Clause 39 of Part I of Second Schedule of Income Tax Ordinance, 2001.
legal_findings.natural_justice: Ample opportunity of hearing was not provided to the appellant.
precedents_considered: Judgment of Peshawar High Court in Writ Petition No.4747-P/2016

key_points.decision: Impugned orders set aside; appeals accepted.
